com.aleozlx.pacswitch

Interface PacswitchAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GatewayMessager, PacswitchClient, PacswitchMessager

    public interface PacswitchAPI
    The platform independent pacswitch service client API, which is used to facilitate WAN connections by communicating with a pacswitch server, thereby user data are switched so as to pass NAT routers both ways. Here are the standards of the lower-level API.

    Fork me on github:
    https://github.com/aleozlx/pacscli4java
    And feel free to pay a visit to the server project:
    https://github.com/aleozlx/pacswitch
    Since:
    May 20, 2014
    Author:
    Alex

    • Method Detail

      • pacClose

        void pacClose()
        Close the connection permanently.

      • pacEnd

        void pacEnd()
        Send a package end sequence

      • pacInit

        boolean pacInit(java.lang.String user,
              java.lang.String password,
              java.lang.String host,
              java.lang.String clienttype)
        Initiate a connection.
        Parameters:
        user - User ID
        password - Password
        host - Server IP Address
        clienttype - A unique string that distinguishes different kind of clients
        Returns:
        Whether a connection is successfully made.

      • pacLoop

        void pacLoop()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Start the event loop for response data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • pacSendData

        boolean pacSendData(java.lang.String recv,
                  byte[]... buffer)
        Send user data, which will be automatically wrapped in a packet.
        Parameters:
        recv - Receiver ID
        buffer - User data
        Returns:
        Whether the packet is successfully sent after, if necessary, multiple retries.

      • pacSocketno

        int pacSocketno()
        Get the file descriptor of the socket
        Returns:
        The file descriptor of the socket

      • pacStart

        Send a package start sequence
        Parameters:
        recv - Receiver ID

      • getSocket

        java.net.Socket getSocket()
        The socket from which I/O streams can be fetched, also is necessary for protocol implementation. This is not actually part of pacswitch API standard
        Returns:
        The socket from which I/O streams can be fetched
